content.question:
Box <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> rests on Box <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, which rests on a flat, rough floor, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. A string with negligible mass pulls on Box <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and the boxes move together to the right with constant speed. The friction force between Box <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and Box <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has magnitude <math alttext="f sub A minus B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub></math> and the friction force between Box <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and the floor has magnitude <math alttext="f sub B F, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></mrow></msub></math>. Another block is placed on top of Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and the string again pulls the boxes so that they move together with a constant speed. How do <math alttext="f sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math alttext="f sub B F, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></mrow></msub></math> change between Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?
<math alttext="f sub A minus B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub></math><math alttext="f sub B minus F, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></mrow></msub></math>AStays the sameStays the sameBStays the sameIncreasesCIncreasesStays the sameDIncreasesIncreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
